instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.
definitions.U6100: What is U6100? this is an SPI ROM chip that holds the BIOS which is necessary for the machine to POST or try and power on..
definitions.PPVRTC_G3H: What is PPVRTC_G3H? PPVRTC_G3H is a 3.3v power rail for the RTC circuit present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state. .
definitions.PLT_RESET_L: What is PLT_RESET_L? PLT_RESET_L is platform reset, this signal keeps the system from POSTing. _L means the signal is asserted when its voltage is low. .
definitions.PPVCC_S0_CPU: What is PPVCC_S0_CPU? The "PPVCC_S0_CPU" power rail is responsible for supplying power to the CPU when the MacBook is fully on, or in the S0 state. This rail is one of the main voltages that the CPU requires for operation. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No usb activity
threads.message:
Clean board, no corrosion.

All test were done on bench nothing connected except for IO board and flex, I tested it without flex too and same problem.

Board has 1.8V <SIGNAL>PPVCC_S0_CPU</SIGNAL> 
CPU gets hot as if it is working, tries to boot but stays around 0.150A
<SIGNAL>PPVRTC_G3H</SIGNAL> 3.3V
<SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL> 3.3v 
<CHIP>U7100</CHIP> 27-28 and 17-18 measure normal

Already tried heating up CPU, clean BIOS on a new <CHIP>U6100</CHIP>, Working SMC but same problem.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No usb activity
threads.message:
Any history available?
Do you get all voltages from page 11?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No usb activity
threads.message: Sheet 11 is all could find, somehow page 11 is missing in my schematic if by page 11 you mean PCH Decoupling page all voltages from that page are present and correct.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No usb activity
threads.message:
Chgeck all traces and solders around <CHIP>U6100</CHIP>/01.
Be sure SPI Bus Termination Series resistors are all good.
